title: Did you ever have an idea for an invention or product that you didn't pursue only to watch someone else make millions with the same idea? - Quora

response.answer_text: That happens all the time to me. And I am supremely relaxed about it. The thing to keep in mind is that: having an idea is not unusual; thousands, maybe millions of people will have the same idea;the race to the patent office may be in vain, as only 3% of all patented things actually turn into marketed products;even if you are among those 3%, you are most likely going to be a large company with its own marketing and manufacturing capabilities;and you’ll have paid through the nose to get that product to that stage. We are talking a good half million to twenty million Dollars if it’s really supposed to be something.So, before you spend your life savings on a doohickie’s patenting process and set up a micro factory in your garage, think twice whether you really can pull this off.

Funny story. My Mother and Father at the time after getting married after 3 years. Noticed a lady put her dog into the car seat belted in. Dog Car seats weren’t invented yet. My Mom came up with this fantastic idea, What if we were to invent pet car seats. But my father was like, That’s to much work, blah blah blah, 2 years after they said this, Some guy made it.
Yes, wearable, always on body cameras in 2003 or 2004. Though I thought everyone would use them as artificial memory aids rather than as police recorders.
